You are here:

SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
VISUALFORCE B2B COMMERCE
Configure the Default Storefront Pages

B2B Commerce for Visualforce defines a set of default pages that support a buyer's experience throughout your storefront. As admin, you have some control over the layouts, widgets, and content that buyers encounter on these pages.

REQUIRED EDITIONS

Salesforce Compatibility

Salesforce Classic (not available in all orgs) and Lightning Experience for Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions.




B2B Commerce Compatibility

B2B Commerce for Visualforce Winter ’21 (version 4.13)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’20 (version 4.12)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’19 (version 4.11)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’19 (version 4.10)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’18 (version 4.9)
IMPORTANT By default, B2B Commerce for Visualforce doesn’t support pages used within <iframe> elements.
Home Page
The Home page provides an entry point for introducing your brand to new buyers, and for previous buyers to quickly access their preferred functionality. Design an intuitive and trusted experience that efficiently and effectively serves your buyers' expectations and intentions. By default, the Home page doesn't provide any unique functionality, but can include several widgets that showcase content or provide shortcuts to carts or orders.
Checkout Page
The Checkout page provides a workflow—either standard checkout or line-level independence (LLI) checkout—for a buyer to place an order. The Checkout page consists of multiple sections, which you can configure independently. You can specify which information you allow a buyer to see and manage, including addresses, shipping options, and more. Many configuration options apply to both standard and LLI checkout, but some apply to only one workflow or the other.
My Account Page
The My Account page provides self-service resources for a logged-in buyer to access their storefront account information and history. The My Account page consists of multiple sections, which you can configure independently. You can specify which information you allow a buyer to see and manage, including their password, saved addresses, order history, and more.
Product Compare Page
The Product Compare page allows a buyer to see a side-by-side comparison of up to four standard products at one time. The buyer can quickly review differences between the selected products' short descriptions, prices, and spec values, and select a product to add to their cart. You can configure which product details you want to show in the comparison.
Product Detail Page
The Product Detail page shows pricing, catalog, inventory, and descriptive information for a specific product. You can configure which details you want to show, and which options are available for ordering the product.
Product List Page
The Product List page shows a list of products that belong to a selected category or that match a user's search query. B2B Commerce for Visualforce references the most recently built product index records for quickly serving results. The Product List page displays only the products that the current storefront user is entitled to view.
Scaled Cart Page
When you enable Cart Scale, the Scaled Cart page replaces the standard Shopping Cart page version 2.0 or 1.0. The Scaled Cart page provides enhancements for a buyer to manage a cart that contains a large number of items. A buyer can sort and search cart items, and browse cart items with pagination controls.
Shopping Cart Page
The Shopping Cart page shows all the products that a buyer has added to the active cart. The buyer can change quantities, move items to a wish list, apply a coupon code, and proceed to the Checkout page. The Shopping Cart page can also include options for sending the cart contents as an email and requesting a quote.
Site Login Page
The Site Login page provides controls for returning buyers to log in to their storefront account. If your storefront supports self-registration, a guest buyer can also navigate to the Site Register page and create an account on your storefront.
Site Register Page
The Site Register page allows a guest user to create an account on your storefront. You can configure some parts of this self-registration experience, such as which fields are available for self-registration or which picklist values are selected by default.

title: Configuring Storefront Pages in Salesforce B2B Commerce
